title: Lowest Common Ancestor
statement: Given a binary tree and two nodes P and Q, find the lowest common ancestor (LCA). LCA is the lowest node that has both P and Q as descendants (a node can be a descendant of itself).
input_format:
First line contains N, P, and Q.
Second line contains N space-separated integers (-1 for null) representing level order.
output_format: Print the value of the LCA node.
constraints:
2 <= actual nodes <= 10^5
All node values are unique.
P and Q exist in the tree.
